required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Infection After Free Fibula Flap Reconstruction of the Mandible: a Retrospective Cohort Study
clinical_study.official_title: Infection After Free Fibula Flap Reconstruction of the Mandible: a Retrospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Mandibular osteitis after flap reconstruction is rare but is a serious infection with significant sequelae.
The aim of this study is to describe this type of infection

primary_outcome.measure: rate of failure after free fibula flap reconstruction of the mandible
primary_outcome.time_frame: Outcome is measured at the end of follow-up (usually between 12 and 24 months after antibiotic therapy disruption]
primary_outcome.description: description of failure after free fibula flap reconstruction of

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of bacteria involved in failure after free fibula flap reconstruction of the mandible
secondary_outcome.time_frame: when bacteria had growth up on culture; usually 2-3 weeks after the sample extracted on the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: epidemiology of bacteria which causes the failure

arm_group.arm_group_label: description of infection of free fibula flap reconstruction

intervention.intervention_name: failure of reconstruction of the mandibule by free fibula flap
intervention.description: description of failure of reconstruction of the mandibule by free fibula flap:delay, type of bacteria involved in the failure, treatment, outcome
intervention.arm_group_label: description of infection of free fibula flap reconstruction

study_pop.textblock: patients having had infection after a free flap reconstruction of the mandibule

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients having had infection after a free bony flap reconstruction of the mandibule treated as an osteomyelitis at the CRIOAc between 2014 and 2020
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-bony flap
